message_1: A radioactive substance has an initial mass of 600 grams and its half-life is 10 days. How much of the substance remains after 30 days?
message_2:
To solve this problem, we can use the formula for radioactive decay:

Final mass = Initial mass * (1/2)^(time elapsed / half-life)

In this case, the initial mass is 600 grams, the half-life is 10 days, and the time elapsed is 30 days. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Final mass = 600 * (1/2)^(30 / 10)

Final mass = 600 * (1/2)^3

Final mass = 600 * (1/8)

Final mass = 75 grams

So, after 30 days, 75 grams of the radioactive substance remains.
